A bond was forming between Tucson and Perceptor, a powerful bond that no pr=
edacon could ever break, the bond of friendship and compassion. He had also=
 listened to Lord Elder and thought it was best to allow him to do what he =
needed to do.  With Tallon and Perceptor in his cab, he was more than conte=
nt and rolls at a good reasonable speed with the two of them in his cab.

"=
 Thank you Perceptor, I'm honored to have you with us.  Now, this is what I=
 call valuable, having friends among you through the best and worst of time=
s, knowing that your comrades are willing to make a great effort to preserv=
e what is most precious, is something even the most priceless of articles c=
an never hold an ounce of wealth to.  Tallon, after hearing how you became =
one of us, it honors me to see how much you have evolved and for that my co=
mpassion for you will never die."

He thinks for a moment, about Hydras, an=
d gathers his words carefully.

"I doubt very much that Hydras has any capa=
city to feel the compassion that all of us are capable of feeling.  I know =
that will be a downfall for him, because without compassion there can be no=
 loyalty, no honor, and most certainly no assurance of victory.  And withou=
t those elements, I doubt very much he will be able to hold his place on th=
e upper hand for much longer.  We have to gather our forces, come together =
as one, and only then will we be able to take back what is rightfully ours =
and preserve what is remaining of our planet."

With his words he comes to =
a slow stop.  His sonar systems could only carry him to a certain range, bu=
t then realizes that he's out of range for proper echolocation system funct=
ion.

"Tallon, I'm out of range for my sonar system.  Could you take my whe=
el for me?  I don't want to hurt anyone or any of you."

He has not

 a good pace. Elder was forced to jog

and on the young Maximal's shoulder
> and pull him to a stop. The two began=
 walking together at a somewhat
